metadata.title: CVE-2012-4397 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in ownCloud before4.0.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the(1) calendar displayname to part.choosecalendar.rowfields.php or (2)part.choosecalendar.rowfields.shared.php in apps/calendar/templates/; or(3) unspecified vectors to apps/contacts/lib/vcard.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4397` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

owncloud - 4.0.6debian-0ubuntu1
owncloud-mysql - 4.0.6debian-0ubuntu1
owncloud-pgsql - 4.0.6debian-0ubuntu1
owncloud-sqlite - 4.0.6debian-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: owncloud package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.6debian-0ubuntu1').
